result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gustavo Angel Serrano-Pena

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

At the request of Attorney Kuszel - by letter filed on 9/27/22. The State advises the victim has no requests. Victim rights compliance. Court will grant request.  PTC set for 9/29/22 at 10 am is removed from the calendar. PLEAS scheduled with Attorney Kuszel and the State by email for 12/2/2022 at 10:00 am. Notice mailed out.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Gustavo Angel Serrano-Pena, appeared with Attorney Paul K Kuszel and span int Leo Martin.   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.    Clerk JT  Minutes:    ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Kuszel. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court has reviewed and approves cancelation of the status conf. and hearing set over for a prelim on 6/23/22 at 8:45 AM.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign denied

09:44 AM Defendant, Gustavo Angel Serrano-Pena, appeared.   Spanish interpreter, Leo Martin, appeared in court. Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Defendant advised the Court that he has retained an attorney and is requesting an adjournment so his attorney may appear. Court finds good cause and tolls time. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
